decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with creatures and utilizing them to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It aims to maximize the value of cards like Hogaak by aggressively filling the graveyard with various creatures through effects like Stitcher's Supplier, Grisly Salvage, and Commune with the Gods. The deck includes ways to power out Hogaak early, such as using cards like Birds of Paradise and Elves of Deep Shadow for ramp. It also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain a strong board presence with powerful threats like Vengevine and Tarmogoyf.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize The Gitrog Monster's ability to draw multiple cards each turn when lands are put into the graveyard to enable a combo win condition. The deck includes cards like Dakmor Salvage to continually put lands into the graveyard, along with cards like Dark Ritual and Crop Rotation to generate mana and find key cards like Cabal Coffers. The deck also includes various land recursion cards like Life from the Loam and Ramunap Excavator to ensure a steady stream of lands are available. The goal is to set up a loop where lands are continually put into the graveyard and drawn to generate infinite mana or create a massive board presence with cards like Splendid Reclamation and Field of the Dead.

The main focus of this deck revolves around controlling the game by disrupting your opponent's plans and resources while ensuring you have the upper hand. This is achieved through a combination of powerful control spells such as Counterspell, Force of Will, and Mana Leak, along with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach. The deck also includes various ways to manipulate the battlefield, such as Parallax Wave and Teferi, Time Raveler, allowing you to dictate the flow of the game. Additionally, the deck includes card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Narset, Parter of Veils to ensure you stay ahead in resources. Ultimately, the goal is to outlast your opponent and win through efficient control and resource management.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. With Kytheon, Hero of Akros as the commander, the deck includes a mix of efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Brave the Elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Cards like Swords to Plowshares and Council's Judgment provide removal options, while equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice enhance the deck's attacking power. The deck also includes mana denial cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The deck focuses on using a variety of control elements and artifacts to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gradually building up resources and advantage. It aims to delay and counter the opponent's plays with counterspells like Force of Will and Cryptic Command, while also utilizing cards like Witching Well and Tezzeret, Artifice Master to generate card advantage. The deck also includes powerful artifacts like Urza, Lord High Artificer and Engineered Explosives to control the board and finish the game. The key strategy is to protect Erayo, Soratami Ascendant and flip her as soon as possible to lock down the opponent's spells, creating a strong advantage for the player.

The deck revolves around overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy focused on dealing direct damage to the opponent. Kari Zev, Skyship Raider leads the charge, backed up by a plethora of burn spells and efficient creatures. The goal is to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they have a chance to establish their game plan. Creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear provide early pressure, while spells like Lightning Bolt and Searing Blaze ensure that the opponent's board stays clear. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon to slow down the opponent's mana development. Overall, the deck aims to be relentless and punishing, never giving the opponent a moment to breathe.

This deck focuses on maximizing control and tempo through the use of spells that interact with the opponent's board and disrupt their game plan. By utilizing partners Rowan and Will Kenrith, the deck can consistently draw cards, counter spells, and manipulate the battlefield to keep the opponent on the back foot. With a mix of counterspells, bounce spells, and card draw, the deck aims to maintain board presence while slowing down the opponent's game plan. By efficiently managing resources and timing spells effectively, the deck can outmaneuver opponents and maintain control of the game until it can secure a win condition, such as decking the opponent with Blue Sun's Zenith or overwhelming them with Ugin, the Spirit Dragon.

This deck focuses on utilizing the partnership of Tymna the Weaver and Thrasios, Triton Hero to maintain card advantage and generate value. It includes a wide range of powerful spells for disruption, interaction, and tutoring. The deck aims to apply pressure through aggressive plays while also having access to various combo pieces and win conditions. With a mix of creatures, spells, and lands that cover all colors, the deck is versatile and can adapt to different situations. The key strategy is to establish board presence, disrupt opponents' plans, and efficiently tutor for key cards to close out the game quickly.

The main objective of this deck is to control the game by ramping up quickly with the help of Azusa, Lost But Seeking's ability to play multiple lands per turn. The deck focuses on tutoring lands, utilizing land destruction, and generating value through land-based synergies. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by removing threats, locking down the board with cards like Maze of Ith and Glacial Chasm, and eventually overwhelming them with powerful threats like Primeval Titan, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Avenger of Zendikar. The deck's win condition is to establish a strong board presence through land tokens from cards like Field of the Dead and Titania, Protector of Argoth, while also being able to tutor for key pieces to close out the game.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategies by utilizing Brago, King Eternal's ability to exile permanents and flicker them back onto the battlefield. The deck focuses on generating card advantage and tempo through counterspells, removal spells, and bounce effects. It aims to maintain control over the game by countering or removing threats while constantly blinking its own permanents for additional value. The deck also includes ways to protect Brago and establish a board presence with creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Palace Jailer. It aims to out-value and outlast the opponent through efficient removal, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria.

The Gitrog Monster deck focuses on utilizing lands to generate value and achieve a combo win condition. The deck includes cards that allow for land tutoring, land recursion, and land sacrifice to draw cards and generate mana. The commander, The Gitrog Monster, provides card draw and allows for additional land drops each turn. The deck includes combo pieces such as Splendid Reclamation and Ramunap Excavator to bring back multiple lands from the graveyard, along with cards like Dark Ritual and Cabal Coffers to generate extra mana. By utilizing lands effectively and efficiently, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and assemble its combo pieces to secure a victory through overwhelming resources and powerful synergies.

This deck focuses on utilizing the partner commanders, Reyhan and Kraum, to generate aggression and value. The deck includes a variety of aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf, Questing Beast, and Brazen Borrower, backed up by removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push. The deck also includes powerful utility cards like Demonic Tutor, Survival of the Fittest, and Snapcaster Mage to help find key cards and outvalue opponents. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the multiple colors in the deck, with a mix of fetch lands, shock lands, and dual lands. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of efficient creatures, removal, and card advantage to secure victory in one-on-one matches.

The deck focuses on utilizing Narset, Enlightened Master's ability to cast spells for free from the top of the library to control the game through powerful spells and card advantage. With a wide range of counterspells, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and establish control of the battlefield. By utilizing red, white, and blue cards, the deck offers a diverse range of answers to various threats while also providing win conditions through Narset's powerful attacks. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's strategy and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana. Overall, the deck is designed to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 format.

The concept of this Prossh, Skyraider of Kher deck is to generate a large amount of tokens and mana quickly, using various mana dorks and land enchantments. The deck aims to combo off with cards like Earthcraft and Prossh's ability to sacrifice creatures and create more tokens, leading to a massive army on the board. Cards like Purphoros, God of the Forge and Xenagos, God of Revels can help deal damage quickly to the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells and disruption to control the board and protect the combo. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of tokens and powerful creatures to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing the partner commanders Thrasios and Tymna to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy with a wide range of powerful creatures and combo pieces. The deck aims to ramp quickly with mana dorks and utilize cards like Birthing Pod and Eldritch Evolution to tutor for key pieces. It also incorporates disruptive elements like Gaddock Teeg and Meddling Mage to disrupt opponents while developing its own board state. The deck includes a toolbox of powerful creatures to adapt to different situations and has the potential to create explosive plays with cards like Aluren and Recruiter of the Guard. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a versatile and aggressive approach.

The deck revolves around utilizing Venser, Shaper Savant as its commander to control the game through various counterspells, bounce effects, and extra turns. The primary strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering their spells, bouncing their key permanents back to their hand, and taking extra turns to pull ahead in resources. The deck includes cards such as Cyclonic Rift, Cryptic Command, Time Warp, and True-Name Nemesis to help achieve this goal. It aims to establish board control while leveraging Venser's abilities to protect itself and maintain a strong position in the game. The deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and outmaneuver them with its control elements.
